languages.javascriptreact:
Hey, nice to see you

Aww yeah, you successfully read this important alert message. This example text is going to run a bit longer so that you can see how spacing within an alert works with this kind of content.

Whenever you need to, be sure to use margin utilities to keep things nice and tidy.
languages.html:
Well done!

Aww yeah, you successfully read this important alert message. This example text is going to run a bit longer so that you can see how spacing within an alert works with this kind of content.

Whenever you need to, be sure to use margin utilities to keep things nice and tidy.

entities.name: Alerts/Large/primary
entities.description:
# Alerts

Provide contextual feedback messages for typical user actions with the handful of available and flexible alert messages.

# Support

- [HTML](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.5/components/alerts/)
- [React](https://react-bootstrap.github.io/components/alerts/)

languages.html: A simple primary alert—check it out!
languages.javascriptreact:
<Alert variant='primary'>
  This is a primary alert—check it out!
</Alert>

entities.name: ButtonGroup/Basic
entities.description:
# Button group
Group a series of buttons together on a single line with the button group, and super-power them with JavaScript.

# Support

- [HTML](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.5/components/button-group/)
- [React](https://react-bootstrap.github.io/components/button-group/)

languages.javascriptreact:
<ButtonGroup size="lg" aria-label="Basic example">
  <Button variant="secondary">Left</Button>
  <Button variant="secondary">Middle</Button>
  <Button variant="secondary">Right</Button>
</ButtonGroup>

entities.name: ButtonGroup/Basic/Large
entities.description:
# Button group
Group a series of buttons together on a single line with the button group, and super-power them with JavaScript.

# Support

- [HTML](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.5/components/button-group/)
- [React](https://react-bootstrap.github.io/components/button-group/)

languages.javascriptreact:
<ButtonGroup size="sm" aria-label="Basic example">
  <Button variant="secondary">First</Button>
  <Button variant="secondary">Second</Button>
  <Button variant="secondary">Third</Button>
</ButtonGroup>

<ButtonGroup vertical aria-label="Basic example">
  <Button variant="secondary">First</Button>
  <Button variant="secondary">Second</Button>
  <Button variant="secondary">Third</Button>
</ButtonGroup>

entities.name: ButtonGroup/Basic/Vertical
entities.description:
# Button group
Group a series of buttons together on a single line with the button group, and super-power them with JavaScript.

# Support

- [HTML](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.5/components/button-group/)
- [React](https://react-bootstrap.github.io/components/button-group/)

languages.html: Dropdown link Dropdown link
languages.javascriptreact:
<ButtonGroup aria-label="Basic example">
  <Button variant="secondary">First</Button>
  <Button variant="secondary">Second</Button>
  <DropdownButton as={ButtonGroup} title="Dropdown" id="bg-nested-dropdown">
	<Dropdown.Item eventKey="1">Dropdown link</Dropdown.Item>
	<Dropdown.Item eventKey="2">Dropdown link</Dropdown.Item>
  </DropdownButton>
</ButtonGroup>

languages.html: This is some text within a card body.
languages.javascriptreact:
<Card>
  <Card.Body>This is some text within a card body.</Card.Body>
</Card>

entities.name: Card/Body
entities.description:
# Cards
Bootstrap’s cards provide a flexible and extensible content container with multiple variants and options.

# Support

- [HTML](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.5/components/card/)
- [React](https://react-bootstrap.github.io/components/card/)

languages.html:
Header
Primary card title

Some quick example text to build on the card title and make up the bulk of the card's content.
languages.javascriptreact:
<Card border="primary" style={{ width: '18rem' }}>
    <Card.Header>Header</Card.Header>
    <Card.Body>
      <Card.Title>Primary Card Title</Card.Title>
      <Card.Text>
        Some quick example text to build on the card title and make up the bulk
        of the card's content.
      </Card.Text>
    </Card.Body>
  </Card>

entities.name: Card/Card Styles/Outline
entities.description:
# Cards
Bootstrap’s cards provide a flexible and extensible content container with multiple variants and options.

# Support

- [HTML](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.5/components/card/)
- [React](https://react-bootstrap.github.io/components/card/)

languages.html:
Header
Primary card title

Some quick example text to build on the card title and make up the bulk of the card's content.

Footer
languages.javascriptreact:
<Card border="primary" style={{ width: '18rem' }}>
    <Card.Header>Header</Card.Header>
    <Card.Body>
      <Card.Title>Primary Card Title</Card.Title>
      <Card.Text>
        Some quick example text to build on the card title and make up the bulk
        of the card's content.
      </Card.Text>
    </Card.Body>
    <Card.Footer>Footer</Card.Footer>
  </Card>

entities.name: Card/Card Styles/Outline/Footer
entities.description:
# Cards
Bootstrap’s cards provide a flexible and extensible content container with multiple variants and options.

# Support

- [HTML](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.5/components/card/)
- [React](https://react-bootstrap.github.io/components/card/)

languages.html:
Header
Primary card title

Some quick example text to build on the card title and make up the bulk of the card's content.
languages.javascriptreact:
<Card
    bg='primary'
    text='white'
    style={{ width: '18rem' }}
    className="mb-2"
  >
    <Card.Header>Header</Card.Header>
    <Card.Body>
      <Card.Title>Primary Card Title </Card.Title>
      <Card.Text>
        Some quick example text to build on the card title and make up the bulk
        of the card's content.
      </Card.Text>
    </Card.Body>
  </Card>

entities.name: Card/Color Styles
entities.description:
# Cards
Bootstrap’s cards provide a flexible and extensible content container with multiple variants and options.

# Support

- [HTML](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.5/components/card/)
- [React](https://react-bootstrap.github.io/components/card/)

languages.html: Some quick example text to build on the card title and make up the bulk of the card's content.
languages.javascriptreact:
<Card style={{ width: '18rem' }}>
  <Card.Img variant="top" src="holder.js/100px180" />
  <Card.Body>
    <Card.Title>Card Title</Card.Title>
    <Card.Text>
      Some quick example text to build on the card title and make up the bulk of
      the card's content.
    </Card.Text>
  </Card.Body>
</Card>

entities.name: Card/Image Caps
entities.description:
# Cards
Bootstrap’s cards provide a flexible and extensible content container with multiple variants and options.

# Support

- [HTML](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.5/components/card/)
- [React](https://react-bootstrap.github.io/components/card/)

languages.html:
Card title

This is a wider card with supporting text below as a natural lead-in to additional content. This content is a little bit longer.

Last updated 3 mins ago

entities.name: Card/Image Caps/Horizontal
entities.description:
# Cards
Bootstrap’s cards provide a flexible and extensible content container with multiple variants and options.

# Support

- [HTML](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.5/components/card/)
- [React](https://react-bootstrap.github.io/components/card/)

languages.javascriptreact:
<Card className="bg-dark text-white">
  <Card.Img src="holder.js/100px270" alt="Card image" />
  <Card.ImgOverlay>
    <Card.Title>Card title</Card.Title>
    <Card.Text>
      This is a wider card with supporting text below as a natural lead-in to
      additional content. This content is a little bit longer.
    </Card.Text>
    <Card.Text>Last updated 3 mins ago</Card.Text>
  </Card.ImgOverlay>
</Card>
languages.html:
Card title

This is a wider card with supporting text below as a natural lead-in to additional content. This content is a little bit longer.

Last updated 3 mins ago

entities.name: Card/Image Overlay
entities.description:
# Cards
Bootstrap’s cards provide a flexible and extensible content container with multiple variants and options.

# Support

- [HTML](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.5/components/card/)
- [React](https://react-bootstrap.github.io/components/card/)

languages.html:
Copy
Card title

Some quick example text to build on the card title and make up the bulk of the card's content.

  • Cras justo odio
  • Dapibus ac facilisis in
  • Vestibulum at eros
Card link Another link
languages.javascriptreact:
<Card style={{ width: '18rem' }}>
  <Card.Img variant="top" src="holder.js/100px180?text=Image cap" />
  <Card.Body>
    <Card.Title>Card Title</Card.Title>
    <Card.Text>
      Some quick example text to build on the card title and make up the bulk of
      the card's content.
    </Card.Text>
  </Card.Body>
  <ListGroup className="list-group-flush">
    <ListGroupItem>Cras justo odio</ListGroupItem>
    <ListGroupItem>Dapibus ac facilisis in</ListGroupItem>
    <ListGroupItem>Vestibulum at eros</ListGroupItem>
  </ListGroup>
  <Card.Body>
    <Card.Link href="#">Card Link</Card.Link>
    <Card.Link href="#">Another Link</Card.Link>
  </Card.Body>
</Card>

entities.name: Card/Kitchen sink
entities.description:
# Cards
Bootstrap’s cards provide a flexible and extensible content container with multiple variants and options.

# Support

- [HTML](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.5/components/card/)
- [React](https://react-bootstrap.github.io/components/card/)

languages.html:
Copy
  • Active
  • Link
  • Disabled
Special title treatment

With supporting text below as a natural lead-in to additional content.

Go somewhere
languages.javascriptreact:

entities.name: Checkbox
entities.description:
# Checkboxes
Each checkbox `<input>` and `<label>` pairing is wrapped in a `<div>` to create our custom control. Structurally, this is the same approach as our default `.form-check`.

  
# Support

- [HTML](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.5/components/forms/#checkboxes)
- [React](https://react-bootstrap.github.io/components/forms/#forms-custom-checkboxes-and-radios)

<>
  <Form.Label htmlFor="inputPassword5">Password</Form.Label>
  <Form.Control
    type="password"
    id="inputPassword5"
    aria-describedby="passwordHelpBlock"
  />
  <Form.Text id="passwordHelpBlock" muted>
    Your password must be 8-20 characters long, contain letters and numbers, and
    must not contain spaces, special characters, or emoji.
  </Form.Text>
</>

entities.name: List Group/Item heading/Center
entities.description:
# List group
List groups are a flexible and powerful component for displaying a series of content. Modify and extend them to support just about any content within.

# Support

- [HTML](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.5/components/list-group/)
- [React](https://react-bootstrap.github.io/components/list-group/)

languages.javascriptreact:
<Navbar bg="light" expand="lg">
  <Navbar.Brand href="#home">React-Bootstrap</Navbar.Brand>
  <Navbar.Toggle aria-controls="basic-navbar-nav" />
  <Navbar.Collapse id="basic-navbar-nav">
    <Nav className="mr-auto">
      <Nav.Link href="#home">Home</Nav.Link>
      <Nav.Link href="#link">Link</Nav.Link>
      <NavDropdown title="Dropdown" id="basic-nav-dropdown">
        <NavDropdown.Item href="#action/3.1">Action</NavDropdown.Item>
        <NavDropdown.Item href="#action/3.2">Another action</NavDropdown.Item>
        <NavDropdown.Item href="#action/3.3">Something</NavDropdown.Item>
        <NavDropdown.Divider />
        <NavDropdown.Item href="#action/3.4">Separated link</NavDropdown.Item>
      </NavDropdown>
    </Nav>
    <Form inline>
      <FormControl type="text" placeholder="Search" className="mr-sm-2" />
      <Button variant="outline-success">Search</Button>
    </Form>
  </Navbar.Collapse>
</Navbar>
languages.html:
Navbar
  • Home (current)
  • Link
  • Dropdown
    Action Another action
    Something else here
  • Disabled
